author: bugale
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
Run the following python code:

```
import subprocess
ps = subprocess.Popen("powershell.exe", stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT)
ps.stdin.write(b'\b')
ps.stdin.flush()
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Since no character was sent, the backspace should be ignored

Actual behavior
---------------
Crash, at ConsoleHostUserInterface.cs:1390.
``` sb.Remove(sb.Length - 1, 1); ``` is called, but sb.Length is 0

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost/host/msh/ConsoleHostUserInterface.cs#L1386-L1396

How to fix
----------------
There should be a check for the length of the string builder, and the code should ignore the backspace if the length is 0
